title: VP, Sales - Locum Tenens
description:
Job Description

Welcome to AMN Healthcare — Where Talent Meets Purpose

Ever wondered what it takes to build one of the largest and most respected healthcare staffing and total talent solutions companies? It takes trailblazers, innovators, and exceptional people like you.

At AMN Healthcare, we don’t just offer jobs — we build careers that make a difference.

Why AMN Healthcare? Because Excellence Is Our Standard:

* Named to *Becker’s Top 150 Places to Work in Healthcare* — three years running.
* Consistently ranked among *SIA’s Largest Staffing Firms in America*.
* Honored with *Modern Healthcare’s Innovators Award* for driving change through innovation.
* Proud holder of *The Joint Commission’s Gold Seal of Approval for Staffing Companies* since 2006.

Job Summary

VP, Sales - Locum Tenens

Dallas, TX – Boca Raton, FL – Atlanta, GA

Position Description

*Lead Locum Tenens Sales Strategies for an Innovator in Healthcare Talent Solutions*

Are you an engaged and energized sales leader seeking an opportunity where you can make a significant impact on a growing and evolving organization? If you are, we invite you to consider the role of SVP, Sales - Locum Tenens at AMN Healthcare! These are just some of the advantages of joining us!

* Create a direct and tangible impact on the Locum Tenens division for a vibrant leader in the healthcare industry. This is an exciting time to join us: we are expanding our influence and looking for a leader who can take us to the next level by achieving our ambitious and coordinated vision and goals for the future.
* Experience the satisfaction and fulfillment that comes with knowing that you are positively influencing the healthcare sector and the communities they serve.
* Enjoy the support of our inspirational executives and leadership group and a team-based approach to meeting and achieving goals.
* Establish credibility and build positive relationships with colleagues throughout all departments at AMN as well as with external contacts including our partners, locum tenens physicians and clients. Your accomplishments will be visible as you meet and exceed your goals and ensure the successful performance of Locum Tenens.

We are a competency-focused organization, and the exemplary candidate for this role will encompass the following strengths: Drive for results, relationship building skills, critical thinking, strategic prowess, and organizational agility.

Role Overview

As the VP, Sales you will inspire leadership and execution of AMN corporate strategies by developing the budget including workforce and production priorities within Locum Tenens, developing sales drivers and motivating team members to achieve our financial goals.

You’ll develop and implement go-to market strategy and ensure revenue targets are met as we continue to navigate through accelerated growth and change. You will manage a team of individual producers as you also provide leadership to the greater sales / recruitment organization of approximately 70+ team members.

Role Specifics

More specifically, your key responsibilities will be to:

* Report financial results to the Executive Committee and Board of Directors including projections detailing revenue generation and profitability opportunities to further refine the operations plans to outpace market factors.
* Strategize with division leadership on a weekly basis to evaluate projections in terms of production metrics to implement plans that address fluctuating regional performance and exceed monthly revenue and budget quota.
* Review financial budgets and business plans from divisional leadership to determine viability and integrate with broader critical initiatives to achieve expected results.
* Establish company goals based on enterprise-wide strategy and implement through divisional leadership.
* Evaluate budget performance for each divisional leader by measuring production results with respect to business drivers to recognize opportunities to improve revenue and profitability growth.
* Establish and enforce organizational metrics that define performance expectations to reward success and diagnose areas and individuals that are below expectations.
* Supervise the attraction and hiring of new team members by partnering with Talent Acquisition, mentoring hiring leaders, and evaluating hiring processes thereby increasing the chances of selecting for the best fit.
* Evaluate Locum Tenens leadership candidates against position profile using interviews and competency assessments to identify those most likely to fit the role and team and learn quickly.
* Manage Locum Tenens headcount through ongoing performance evaluations according to competency and top grading standards to improve staff productivity metrics.
* Coach and mentor team members on sales management and leadership skills through observation and encouragement to foster personal growth, career development and succession opportunities.
* Be responsible for the development process for sales team members within the business line to identify strategic actions that address international, global, and enterprise-wide development opportunities.
* Manage employee and leader concerns by advocating for team members while maintaining compliance with corporate and legal perspective to minimize workforce disruptions and retain committed team members.
* Sponsor and lead sales process improvements throughout Locums including implementation.
* Facilitate innovation and execution of process changes across production, Marketing, IT, Shared Services, and all relevant corporate partners.
* Champion new processes across multiple divisions (shared services, business and corporate) by taking a well-rounded view of problems/opportunities while proposing value, casting vision, and managing change.
* Measure the viability of process improvements and system enhancements by quantifying recommendations geared towards reducing waste and increasing business results. Formulate and measure return on investment throughout projects and initiatives.
* Prepare company presentations for monthly, quarterly, and annual meetings to update the Executive Committee on financial and organizational strengths and gaps.
* Use corporate resources, policies and structure to staff and develop engaged teams to achieve strategic and financial goals with the largest return for the company.

To be a strong fit for this opportunity we are looking for:

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
* 7 years of sales experience
* 5 years of Enterprise Sales leadership experience and a proven track record of coaching and mentoring teams via strong funnel management
* Strong financial competence, experience managing budgets and revenues of at least $100M
* High-energy, tenacious, and creative, able to put in the effort to empower others
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible, and friendly
* Ability to communicate effectively and build strategic relationships

Preferred Experience:

* Experience in healthcare staffing sales/recruiting
* Physician-specific experience in some capacity (health systems, locum tenens, physician practices, etc.)

You should also be willing and able to travel as needed to visit clients, other locations and attend meetings / events

At AMN we recognize that in-person connections have value and promote collaboration. You will be expected to come into an AMN Healthcare office at a frequency dependent on the work arrangement for your role.

Pay Rate

$200,000 - $250,000 Salary

Final pay rate is dependent on experience, training, education, and location.

This position may include additional compensation such as bonus or commission. Please ask your recruiter for more information.

title: VP, National Accounts & Advisory Enterprise Sales
description:
Vestwell is the financial technology company powering the new savings economy. The New York City-based fintech platform redefines how people save for the critical aspects of life across retirement, education, and healthcare savings needs. Today, Vestwell enables over 350,000 businesses and nearly 1.5 Million active savers, with over $30 billion in assets saved across all 50 United States.

Vestwell offers a range of products, including workplace-delivered retirement plans, employer-offered student loan repayment benefits, and various savings accounts for education, emergencies, and individuals with disabilities.

Vestwell's platform serves a diverse clientele, including financial advisers, employers, third-party administrators, financial institutions, payroll providers, government agencies, and individual savers. To learn more, visit vestwell.com

**Who Are We Looking For?**

The Vestwell team is growing and we're excited to bring onboard a VP, National Accounts and Advisory Enterprise Sales who will play an integral role in how we reach our revenue targets. You will be responsible for outreach to advisory firms in your territory, closing plans and partnerships with these groups. You will also be responsible for building out partnerships in the payroll channel to drive retirement plan sales.

The ideal candidate will be a motivated team player who possesses a positive "can do" attitude, a high degree of attention to detail, professionalism, and drive in order to undertake the wide latitude of responsibilities inherent with a rapidly growing company.  
  
**What Will You Be Doing?**

At its core, you will contribute to the quality of our client's end-to-end experience by providing vital support to the growing sales team at Vestwell.

Day-to-day you will also be expected to:

* Drive enterprise sales and strategy efforts overseeing specific Advisory segments (firm scope includes wealth managers, broker dealers, banks and corporate RIAs) in pursuit of enterprise CARR and National Account partnerships. This role will focus specifically on Supra/Regional Banks, IBDs, Corporate RIAs, and may expand over time.
* Responsible for achieving CARR and plan volume goals associated with Advisory, Payroll and National Accounts. As the commercial owner, responsible for enablement pre-deal and post-deal sales with Enterprise RM, Sales Enablement, and National Sales working closely with the Partner Success and Enterprise Relationship Management team.
* Manage and create marketing strategies and resources, own marketing budget associated with National Account and Enterprise clients.
* Collaborate cross-functionally on complex client requirements, both pre-deal and post deal.

**Requirements**

The Necessities:

* Ability to build lead complex deals working internally to bring Vestwell to the client
* Ability to manage multiple projects and relationships to drive long-term prospect goals
* Ability to influence C-suite executives
* A deep network in wealth management and retirement
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
* Familiarity and overall comfort using various software platforms (i.e MS Office and CRM databases)
* Hyper-effective organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
* Strong customer and commercial-focused philosophy
* Ability to work within a team to achieve common goals
* Ability to work with a sense of urgency
* A highly motivated, self-starter who thrives on going fast and who can iterate rapidly
* Articulate, concise, eloquent communication skills to be the voice outwardly and inwardly
* Ability to work effectively and professionally with a wide range of personalities, roles, and teams
* Strong work ethic with the ability to work both independently and on a team

This role could be based in our New York City HQ and will be part of Vestwell's hybrid in-office operation.

The expected base salary range for this position is $150K - $160K base, in addition to a performance variable, with an OTE of $250K - $260K. This position is eligible to participate in the Company Bonus Pool and is eligible to receive new hire equity in the Company. Please note that salary bands are based on New York and other similar metro areas and may differ based on where the role is ultimately hired.

**OUR BENEFITS**

We're an innovative, high-growth company, with lots of exciting milestones ahead. We value health and wellness at Vestwell and in addition to a dedicated Employee Wellbeing Committee, we offer competitive health coverage and generous vacation offering. We have adopted a hybrid office policy, but all employees are welcome at our bright, comfortable office with many workspace options in our Midtown Manhattan, Austin, King of Prussia, and Phoenix offices, so everyone has a setting that is the most productive for them. Oh, and naturally we have a great 401(k) plan!

**OUR PROCESS**  
  
It starts the same for every candidate: getting to know the team members through 1-2 conversations about Vestwell, your experience, and your interests. Next steps can vary by role, but the usual next steps are a skill or experience screen (e.g. a coding interview for an Engineer, a portfolio review for a Designer, deeper experience call for other roles) which leads to a virtual or in-person interview panel after that if the screens go well. *Before making an offer, our interview process concludes with a references check stage for your recruiter to meet with a current or former supervisor and peer.* We prioritize transparency and lack of surprise throughout the process.

For your awareness you will only receive correspondence from recruiting@vestwell.com any other domain not ending in Vestwell.com is not our Recruitment team.

*Vestwell's* *Privacy Policy.* *Attention California residents: In the course of conducting our business and complying with federal, state, and local government regulations governing such matters as employment, tax, insurance, etc., we must collect Personal Information from you. Should you accept employment with Vestwell you may view our California Privacy Rights Act here:* *Vestwell's California Privacy Rights Policy.*

title: Vice President – IBO Sales
description:
**Role Overview**

The Vice President – IPO Sales will lead and scale the sales function for Intelligent Process Operations (IPO), driving revenue growth through new client acquisition, strategic partnerships, and expansion of existing accounts. This role requires a strong hunter mindset combined with consultative selling expertise in complex, transformation-led deals.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Sales Strategy & Leadership**

* Define and execute the IPO sales strategy aligned with organizational growth objectives.
* Build and lead a high-performing sales team focused on enterprise and mid-market clients.
* Develop scalable sales processes, pipelines, and forecasting mechanisms.

**Revenue Growth & New Business**

* Drive new logo acquisition for IPO and digital process transformation services.
* Own and achieve revenue, bookings, and pipeline targets.
* Identify and pursue large, multi-year, transformation-led deals.

**Client Engagement & Deal Management**

* Act as an executive sponsor during complex deal cycles.
* Lead client conversations around intelligent automation, AI, analytics, and digital operations.
* Collaborate with solutioning, operations, and technology teams to craft compelling proposals.

**Partnerships & Market Expansion**

* Build and manage strategic alliances and channel partnerships.
* Track market trends, competitor offerings, and emerging opportunities.
* Expand presence across geographies and verticals.

**Pre-Sales & Commercial Excellence**

* Oversee RFP responses, pricing, commercials, and contract negotiations.
* Ensure strong governance in deal qualification, risk assessment, and margin protection.

**Key Skills & Competencies**

* Proven enterprise sales leadership experience in IPO, BPO, BPM, or digital services.
* Strong understanding of Intelligent Process Operations, automation, AI, and analytics.
* Excellent negotiation, stakeholder management, and executive presence.
* Ability to sell high-value, consultative, and transformation-focused solutions.
* Strong pipeline management and forecasting skills.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree required; MBA preferred.
* 12–18+ years of experience in enterprise sales, with 5+ years in a senior leadership role.
* Proven track record of closing multi-million-dollar deals.

**Preferred Experience**

* Experience selling AI-led, automation-first, or digital transformation solutions.
* Exposure to global clients and complex buying environments.
* Strong network across industries such as BFSI, Healthcare, CX, or Technology.

Pay: $150,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
BEC Technologies is a leader in 4G/LTE and 5G industrial IoT and networking, delivering secure, reliable connectivity for system integrators, carriers, managed service providers (MSPs), and enterprise customers worldwide. We build advanced wireless WAN, edge computing, and AI-connected solutions that power mission-critical networks and applications. Our people drive this mission, and it is their ideas, collaboration, and commitment that fuel the innovation behind our products and help customers thrive in a digital-first world.

**Role Overview:**

The Vice President of Sales is a senior executive responsible for building, leading, and scaling BEC’s revenue organization. This leader will define the sales strategy, strengthen partner and channel ecosystems, accelerate market penetration across core verticals, and drive consistent, predictable growth. The role requires strong experience in telecommunications, wireless networking, and industrial IoT, combined with the ability to lead a high-performance team and collaborate across product, marketing, engineering, and operations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Foster a collaborative and results-oriented team culture, focused on continuous improvement and professional growth.
* Develop and implement strategies to optimize the performance of each sales region, ensuring consistent and predictable revenue growth.
* Establish organizational structures, staffing, processes, and methods to ensure successful achievement of sales targets and objectives.
* Ensure NetSuite is always up to date with accurate opportunities, notes, and next steps.
* Set sales targets for each region and then deliver on those goals.
* Build sales quotas and manage major commissions with sales operations and finance.
* Provide hands-on support to sales leaders, including participating in key customer engagements and negotiations as needed.
* Collaborate with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment of sales strategies with company goals.
* Drive the development and execution of sales strategies to achieve and exceed revenue targets provided by company leadership.
* Implement best practices in sales forecasting, pipeline management, and reporting to ensure accurate and predictable revenue outcomes.
* Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics, adjusting strategies and tactics to address any gaps or opportunities.
* Ensure that all field sales teams are deeply engaged with customers, understanding their needs, and delivering value-added solutions.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Champion a customer-first approach across all field sales teams, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty.

**Required Qualifications**

* 15+ years of experience in field sales or a similar role within the networking, telecommunications, or IoT industry.
* Minimum of 5 years in a leadership role, with proven experience managing and developing sales teams.
* Familiarity with the 4G/5G industrial IoT, networking, SD-WAN, and secure edge-compute solutions markets.

· Established senior executive relationships at AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile, and major MVNOs

* Experience working in a global organization with multiple sales regions and diverse product lines.
* Demonstrated ability to lead high performing sales teams, driving predictable revenue growth and achieving sales targets.
* Strong industry references.
* Deep understanding of the sales process, including pipeline management, forecasting, and closing large, complex deals.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to travel as needed to support global field sales teams and customer engagements.

**What We Offer**

* Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives.
* Professional growth and leadership development opportunities.
* A collaborative, innovative environment focused on customer success and continuous improvement.
* Medical, dental, and vision coverage
* Life insurance and 401(k) with company match
* Paid vacation and sick leave

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $80,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Richardson, TX 75082

title: Vice President of Sales & Marketing
description:
**We're Hiring!**

**Vice President of Sales & Marketing**

If you believe great products deserve great storytelling—and that marketing should directly drive demand, not just awareness—this role was built for you.

Vintage Air is the industry leader in performance air conditioning systems for classic cars, hot rods, and custom builds. Our products live under the hoods of some of the most respected vehicles in the automotive aftermarket, and our brand is trusted by enthusiasts, professional shops, and builders worldwide.

We’re opening a **Vice President of Sales & Marketing** role with a **strong marketing focus**. This is a **hands-on position** for someone who wants to personally **build, execute, measure, and refine** marketing and go-to-market initiatives—while staying deeply connected to the product, the customer, and the enthusiast culture.

This is not a high-level oversight role. You will be **doing the work**.

**What You’ll Own**

You will own Vintage Air’s marketing-led go-to-market execution across:

* **Digital and direct channels**
* **Distributor and installer networks**
* **OEM and builder relationships**
* **Enthusiast and professional shop communities**

Your mission is to **create demand, strengthen brand leadership, and support revenue growth** through thoughtful, data-driven marketing execution.

Key responsibilities include:

* Developing and executing integrated marketing and GTM strategies that support revenue and growth objectives
* Crafting and refining brand messaging and positioning for highly technical, engineered products
* Creating and managing content across web, email, social, and video platforms
* Driving digital performance, including website UX, merchandising, conversion optimization, and retention
* Managing CRM and marketing automation tools to support campaigns, lead flow, and customer lifecycle engagement
* Analyzing campaign performance, customer behavior, and market trends to guide decisions
* Supporting product launches with compelling narratives, assets, and coordinated GTM execution
* Partnering closely with sales, product, operations, and supply chain to ensure alignment from demand generation through fulfillment
* Representing the Vintage Air brand authentically at industry events and within the automotive enthusiast community
* This position requires seasonal travel (25-35%), while the majority of work is performed on-site at the primary work location

If you enjoy being close to the work and seeing the direct impact of your efforts, you’ll thrive here.

**What We’re Looking For (Required Qualifications)**

* 10+ years of experience in **Marketing** or marketing-led Sales roles
* 5+ years of experience in a **manufacturing environment**
* Proven success executing **multi-channel go-to-market strategies**
* Experience marketing **technical or engineered products**
* Strong working knowledge of **CRM and marketing automation platforms**
* Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into action
* Comfort working independently in a fast-paced, hands-on environment

**What Will Set You Apart (Preferred Experience)**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or a related field
* Automotive aftermarket or durable goods manufacturing experience
* Experience supporting distributor, installer, or dealer-based sales models
* Strong digital commerce, UX, and conversion optimization experience
* Genuine passion for classic cars, hot rods, or automotive culture
* Experience in digital marketing strategies, platforms, and performance measurement

**Why Vintage Air**

* A **highly respected brand** with deep credibility in the enthusiast community
* Direct ownership of marketing strategy and execution
* High visibility and impact—your work will shape the brand
* A culture that values craftsmanship, authenticity, and technical excellence
* Based in **San Antonio, Texas**, with a collaborative, hands-on environment

title: Area Vice President - Growth/Sales - Health Systems & Providers
description:
**Company Description**

PG Forsta is the leading experience measurement, data analytics, and insights provider for complex industries—a status we earned over decades of deep partnership with clients to help them understand and meet the needs of their key stakeholders. Our earliest roots are in U.S. healthcare –perhaps the most complex of all industries. Today we serve clients around the globe in every industry to help them improve the Human Experiences at the heart of their business. We serve our clients through an unparalleled offering that combines technology, data, and expertise to enable them to pinpoint and prioritize opportunities, accelerate improvement efforts and build lifetime loyalty among their customers and employees.

Like all great companies, our success is a function of our people and our culture. Our employees have world-class talent, a collaborative work ethic, and a passion for the work that have earned us trusted advisor status among the world’s most recognized brands. As a member of the team, you will help us create value for our clients, you will make us better through your contribution to the work and your voice in the process. Ours is a path of learning and continuous improvement; team efforts chart the course for corporate success.

**Our Mission:**

We empower organizations to deliver the best experiences. With industry expertise and technology, we turn data into insights that drive innovation and action.

**Our Values:**

To put Human Experience at the heart of organizations so every person can be seen and understood.

* **Energize the customer relationship:** Our clients are our partners. We make their goals our own, working side by side to turn challenges into solutions.
* **Success starts with me:** Personal ownership fuels collective success. We each play our part and empower our teammates to do the same.
* **Commit to learning:** Every win is a springboard. Every hurdle is a lesson. We use each experience as an opportunity to grow.
* **Dare to innovate:** We challenge the status quo with creativity and innovation as our true north.
* **Better together:** We check our egos at the door. We work together, so we win together.

**Location:** Clients are based primarily in IL, WI, and NE. Candidates that live within these states are preferred. Work arrangement is either Remote/Work From Home or Hybrid based at our Chicago, IL.

Press Ganey improves the Human Experience in healthcare through innovation, data-driven insight, and action. We bring deep expertise, layered on top of groundbreaking technology. And together? That’s where the magic happens. We partner to center every organization around the individual, and the experiences of patients, members, consumers, and employees, so our clients can unlock their people’s potential and build stronger, healthier communities.

Our clients are our partners. We make their goals our own, working side by side to turn challenges into solutions.

As a member of our Growth team, you'll position these solutions that bring together the data, tech, insights, and personal expertise to propel our client’s organization into a new era. Our proven solutions are the right answer to healthcare’s once-unsolvable problems.

Check out these impressive data points:

* 1B patient + 3.1M caregiver voices
* 1 Human Experience (HX) platform
* Partner with over 41,000 hospitals, health plans, and life sciences organizations
* 98% of U.S. Health Plan enrollees represented

The Area Vice President's primary responsibility is to retain assigned health system and provider clients by securing long term renewals of existing contracts, as well as growing revenue by selling Press Ganey solutions to the clients.

Duties and Responsibilities:

* Serve as the overall strategic relationship manager for the client and be responsible for retaining existing client revenue through outstanding relationships at all levels, especially within the executive suite.
* Deliver consistently on financial growth targets (quota) for new and expansion business within defined clients.
* Create comprehensive client plans that outline strategies for achieving client objectives and financial growth targets (quota).
* Gain and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the entire product portfolio, including features, benefits, and use cases.
* Understand how the products compare to competitors' offerings, including strengths and weaknesses.
* Participate in all required training sessions, workshops, and webinars provided by the company and complete any required certifications and tests to demonstrate proficiency in product knowledge and sales techniques.
* This is an individual contributor role that will succeed by leading teams through influence.
* Analyze client needs and market trends to identify opportunities for growth and expansion within the client and/or territory.
* Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations.
* Create and present detailed sales proposals tailored to the specific needs of clients.
* Negotiate terms of sales agreements to maximize revenue and profit.
* Work cross functionally across Press Ganey, specifically partnering with Client Success and Advisory, to fulfill the client value proposition and address client needs/concerns.
* Build and strengthen relationships with key stakeholders across various levels of the client organization especially within and across the C-suite.
* Maintain up-to-date records of all sales activities and client interactions in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system.

Qualifications:

* 5+ years of quota carrying account management and/or sales experience.
* Understanding of the unique opportunities and challenges within healthcare, specifically health systems / providers.
* SaaS solutions experience highly preferred.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, listening, and presentations skills.
* Solid working knowledge of strategic planning, execution of strategy, business development and sales.
* Demonstrated solid leadership qualities and organizational skills.
* Must be sales / results driven.
* Strong relationship building skills.

Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.  
  
Flexible to travel up to 50% or more.

To work #BetterTogether, we embrace a hybrid model for team members located near our hubs in **Chicago, South Bend, or Boston**. We gather in-office three days a week (Tuesday–Thursday), with remote flexibility on other days. This schedule may adjust based on travel needs.

**Don’t meet every single requirement?** Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At PG Forsta we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

**Additional Information for US based jobs:**

Press Ganey Associates LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and well committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Notice – Press Ganey will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

The expected base salary for this position ranges from $100,000 - $155,000. It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to base salary and a competitive benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus or commission tied to achieved results.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our privacy policy can be found here: https://www.pressganey.com/legal-privacy/

* 1B patient + 3.1M caregiver voices
* 1 Human Experience (HX) platform
* Partner with over 41,000 hospitals, health plans, and life sciences organizations
* 98% of U.S. Health Plan enrollees represented

The Area Vice President's primary responsibility is to retain assigned health system and provider clients by securing long term renewals of existing contracts, as well as growing revenue by selling Press Ganey solutions to the clients.

Duties and Responsibilities:

* Serve as the overall strategic relationship manager for the client and be responsible for retaining existing client revenue through outstanding relationships at all levels, especially within the executive suite.
* Deliver consistently on financial growth targets (quota) for new and expansion business within defined clients.
* Create comprehensive client plans that outline strategies for achieving client objectives and financial growth targets (quota).
* Gain and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the entire product portfolio, including features, benefits, and use cases.
* Understand how the products compare to competitors' offerings, including strengths and weaknesses.
* Participate in all required training sessions, workshops, and webinars provided by the company and complete any required certifications and tests to demonstrate proficiency in product knowledge and sales techniques.
* This is an individual contributor role that will succeed by leading teams through influence.
* Analyze client needs and market trends to identify opportunities for growth and expansion within the client and/or territory.
* Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations.
* Create and present detailed sales proposals tailored to the specific needs of clients.
* Negotiate terms of sales agreements to maximize revenue and profit.
* Work cross functionally across Press Ganey, specifically partnering with Client Success and Advisory, to fulfill the client value proposition and address client needs/concerns.
* Build and strengthen relationships with key stakeholders across various levels of the client organization especially within and across the C-suite.
* Maintain up-to-date records of all sales activities and client interactions in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system.

Qualifications:

* 5+ years of quota carrying account management and/or sales experience.
* Understanding of the unique opportunities and challenges within healthcare, specifically health systems / providers.
* SaaS solutions experience highly preferred.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, listening, and presentations skills.
* Solid working knowledge of strategic planning, execution of strategy, business development and sales.
* Demonstrated solid leadership qualities and organizational skills.
* Must be sales / results driven.
* Strong relationship building skills.

Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.  
  
Flexible to travel up to 50% or more.

To work #BetterTogether, we embrace a hybrid model for team members located near our hubs in **Chicago, South Bend, or Boston**. We gather in-office three days a week (Tuesday–Thursday), with remote flexibility on other days. This schedule may adjust based on travel needs.

title: Vice President of Sales - East
description:
McKesson is an impact-driven, Fortune 10 company that touches virtually every aspect of healthcare. We are known for delivering insights, products, and services that make quality care more accessible and affordable. Here, we focus on the health, happiness, and well-being of you and those we serve – we care.

What you do at McKesson matters. We foster a culture where you can grow, make an impact, and are empowered to bring new ideas. Together, we thrive as we shape the future of health for patients, our communities, and our people. If you want to be part of tomorrow’s health today, we want to hear from you.

The Vice President of Sales at McKesson Corporation in the health systems segment is a pivotal leadership role responsible for driving revenue growth, developing and executing strategic sales initiatives, and leading a high-performing sales organization to achieve and exceed business objectives across designated market segments.  
  
**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement comprehensive sales strategies aligned with McKesson's overall business goals, market trends, and customer needs.
* Lead, mentor, and motivate a large, diverse team of sales directors, managers, and account executives, fostering a culture of high performance, accountability, and continuous improvement.
* Oversee the entire sales cycle, from pipeline generation and qualification to negotiation and close, ensuring consistent execution and adherence to best practices.
* Establish and manage sales targets, quotas, and KPIs, regularly analyzing sales performance data and implementing corrective actions as needed.
* Identify new market opportunities, develop strategies for market penetration, and expand McKesson's customer base.
* Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key customers, strategic partners, and industry influencers.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product development, operations, and finance teams to ensure seamless customer experiences and alignment of sales efforts with broader company initiatives.
* Manage sales budgets, optimize resource allocation, and ensure cost-effective sales operations.
* Stay abreast of industry developments, competitive landscapes, and regulatory changes to inform sales strategies and maintain a competitive edge.
* Represent McKesson at industry conferences, trade shows, and other external events to promote brand awareness and generate leads.
* Drive the adoption of new sales technologies and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

**Minimum Requirement**

Degree or equivalent experience. Typically requires 12+ years of professional experience and 4+ years of management experience.

**Education**  
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field; MBA preferred.

**Critical Skills**

* 12+ years of progressive experience in sales/account management, with at least 4 years in a senior leadership role (e.g., Regional Sales Director, VP of Sales) within a large, complex organization.
* Demonstrated track record of consistently achieving and exceeding ambitious sales targets and driving significant revenue growth.
* Proven ability to build, lead, develop, and inspire high-performing sales teams across diverse geographies and product lines.
* Exceptional strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to translate market insights into actionable sales strategies.
* Strong financial acumen and experience managing large sales budgets and forecasting.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, with the ability to influence and build rapport with C-level executives and key stakeholders.
* Deep understanding of the healthcare industry, including its challenges, opportunities, and regulatory environment.
* Proficiency with CRM software (e.g., Salesforce) and other sales enablement tools.
* Ability to travel extensively as required to meet business needs.

**Additional Skills**

* Pharmaceutical distribution experience preferred.
* Demonstrated success in implementing a strategy and working through change and issue resolutions. Effective problem-solving skills on a wide scale.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data to inform business decisions.
* Innovative/creative approach to sales and business solutions.
* Sense of ownership and personal accountability to excel and achieve sales results through account retention and expansion.

**Physical Requirements**

* General Office Demands.
* Ability to travel up to 40%, depending on market needs.

We are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at McKesson as part of our Total Rewards. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. The pay range shown below is aligned with McKesson's pay philosophy, and pay will always be compliant with any applicable regulations. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered. For more information regarding benefits at McKesson, please click here.

**Our Total Target Cash (TTC) Pay Range for this position:**

$222,700 - $371,100

Total Target Cash (TTC) is defined as base pay plus target incentive.

McKesson has become aware of online recruiting-related scams in which individuals who are not affiliated with or authorized by McKesson are using McKesson’s (or affiliated entities, like CoverMyMeds or RxCrossroads) name in fraudulent emails, job postings or social media messages. In light of these scams, please bear the following in mind:  
  
McKesson Talent Advisors will never solicit money or credit card information in connection with a McKesson job application.

McKesson Talent Advisors do not communicate with candidates via online chatrooms or using email accounts such as Gmail or Hotmail. Note that McKesson does rely on a virtual assistant (Gia) for certain recruiting-related communications with candidates.

McKesson job postings are posted on our career site: careers.mckesson.com.

**McKesson is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

McKesson provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other legally protected category. For additional information on McKesson’s full Equal Employment Opportunity policies, visit our Equal Employment Opportunity page.

**Join us at McKesson!**

**Location:** Clients are based primarily in IL, WI, and NE. Candidates that live within these states are preferred. Work arrangement is either Remote/Work From Home or Hybrid based at our Chicago, IL.

Press Ganey improves the Human Experience in healthcare through innovation, data-driven insight, and action. We bring deep expertise, layered on top of groundbreaking technology. And together? That’s where the magic happens. We partner to center every organization around the individual, and the experiences of patients, members, consumers, and employees, so our clients can unlock their people’s potential and build stronger, healthier communities.

Our clients are our partners. We make their goals our own, working side by side to turn challenges into solutions.

As a member of our Growth team, you'll position these solutions that bring together the data, tech, insights, and personal expertise to propel our client’s organization into a new era. Our proven solutions are the right answer to healthcare’s once-unsolvable problems.

Check out these impressive data points:

* 1B patient + 3.1M caregiver voices
* 1 Human Experience (HX) platform
* Partner with over 41,000 hospitals, health plans, and life sciences organizations
* 98% of U.S. Health Plan enrollees represented

The Area Vice President's primary responsibility is to retain assigned health system and provider clients by securing long term renewals of existing contracts, as well as growing revenue by selling Press Ganey solutions to the clients.

Duties and Responsibilities:

* Serve as the overall strategic relationship manager for the client and be responsible for retaining existing client revenue through outstanding relationships at all levels, especially within the executive suite.
* Deliver consistently on financial growth targets (quota) for new and expansion business within defined clients.
* Create comprehensive client plans that outline strategies for achieving client objectives and financial growth targets (quota).
* Gain and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the entire product portfolio, including features, benefits, and use cases.
* Understand how the products compare to competitors' offerings, including strengths and weaknesses.
* Participate in all required training sessions, workshops, and webinars provided by the company and complete any required certifications and tests to demonstrate proficiency in product knowledge and sales techniques.
* This is an individual contributor role that will succeed by leading teams through influence.
* Analyze client needs and market trends to identify opportunities for growth and expansion within the client and/or territory.
* Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations.
* Create and present detailed sales proposals tailored to the specific needs of clients.
* Negotiate terms of sales agreements to maximize revenue and profit.
* Work cross functionally across Press Ganey, specifically partnering with Client Success and Advisory, to fulfill the client value proposition and address client needs/concerns.
* Build and strengthen relationships with key stakeholders across various levels of the client organization especially within and across the C-suite.
* Maintain up-to-date records of all sales activities and client interactions in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system.

Qualifications:

* 5+ years of quota carrying account management and/or sales experience.
* Understanding of the unique opportunities and challenges within healthcare, specifically health systems / providers.
* SaaS solutions experience highly preferred.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, listening, and presentations skills.
* Solid working knowledge of strategic planning, execution of strategy, business development and sales.
* Demonstrated solid leadership qualities and organizational skills.
* Must be sales / results driven.
* Strong relationship building skills.

Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.  
  
Flexible to travel up to 50% or more.

To work #BetterTogether, we embrace a hybrid model for team members located near our hubs in **Chicago, South Bend, or Boston**. We gather in-office three days a week (Tuesday–Thursday), with remote flexibility on other days. This schedule may adjust based on travel needs.

**Don’t meet every single requirement?** Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At PG Forsta we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

**Additional Information for US based jobs:**

Press Ganey Associates LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and well committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Notice – Press Ganey will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

The expected base salary for this position ranges from $100,000 - $155,000. It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to base salary and a competitive benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus or commission tied to achieved results.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our privacy policy can be found here: https://www.pressganey.com/legal-privacy/

title: Vice President of Sales
description:
**Position Overview**

We are seeking an experienced, dynamic, and results-driven **Vice President of Sales** to lead our US sales strategy and accelerate business growth. The ideal candidate will have a strong track record in financial services outsourcing, with proven ability to develop new client relationships, drive revenue expansion, and develop channel partnerships.

This role will be pivotal in shaping our sales direction in the US market and will work closely with the leadership team to align sales objectives with the company’s growth strategy.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead and execute the sales strategy for US operations across service lines (accounting, tax, valuation, financial due diligence, investment banking support).
* Identify, pursue, and close new business opportunities with small and mid-market clients.
* Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with PE and IB firms, start up incubators, CFOs of target clients and consulting firms such as CPA’s, temp CFO’s and valuation firms.
* Collaborate with the marketing, and leadership teams to drive growth.
* Represent us at industry events, conferences, and networking forums to enhance brand presence.
* Provide regular reporting, pipeline management, and market insights to leadership.
* Grow the sales team as the business scales.

**Requirements**

* **Minimum 5 years of experience** in business development, or sales roles in the **financial services outsourcing** industry (mandatory).
* Proven experience in **offshore or global delivery business models** (compulsory).
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and BD skills.
* Self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset and ability to work independently.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or a related field (MBA preferred).

**Ideal Candidate**

* A young, energetic, and strategic professional with a passion for sales leadership.
* Someone who thrives in fast-paced environments and can balance strategic planning with hands-on execution.
* Adept at consultative selling, relationship management, and understanding client needs in depth

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

* How many years of experience do you have in business development, or sales roles in the financial services outsourcing industry
* Do you have experience in offshore or global delivery business models?

Work Location: Remote

title: Regional Vice President of Local Sales- Central Region
description:
**Location:** North East Region (Remote-Travel Required)  
**Industry:** Commercial Roofing / Construction  
**Full-Time | Base Salary + Incentive | Car Allowance | Full Benefits**

**About Nations Roof**

Nations Roof is one of the largest and most respected commercial roofing contractors in the U.S., with operations in all 50 states. We deliver full-lifecycle roofing solutions, including new construction, replacements, repairs, and maintenance. Backed by certified crews, a 24/7/365 National Service Center, and an industry-leading EMR of 0.48, we are committed to protecting buildings, budgets, and reducing stress for facility teams. Learn more at www.nationsroof.com.

**The Role: Regional Vice President of Local Sales**

This executive-level position is instrumental in driving strategic growth at the regional level. The **Regional Vice President of Local Sales** will be responsible for designing, leading, and executing market-specific sales initiatives that align with national strategies and meet branch-level revenue goals.

You will collaborate directly with Business Unit Leaders, Regional Managers, and Sales Teams across assigned branches to develop localized strategies, build high-performance sales cultures, and ensure execution that drives top-line growth and profitability.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Champion and communicate the company's vision across assigned regions, aligning local sales efforts with national strategies.
* Develop and lead comprehensive regional sales strategies focused on growth and market share expansion.
* Drive high-performance sales execution by partnering with branch leadership and national account teams.
* Translate national initiatives into actionable local plans—ensuring consistent messaging, branding, and customer experience.
* Monitor regional KPIs and sales targets, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize performance and identify opportunities.
* Lead and mentor local sales teams, providing support in recruitment, onboarding, training, and development.
* Establish and manage effective sales enablement tools, training programs, and performance benchmarks.
* Stay abreast of market trends, competitor activity, and industry best practices to continuously enhance regional sales strategies.
* Coordinate closely with marketing, operations, and executive teams to support go-to-market initiatives.
* Travel within assigned region to support teams, attend client meetings, and maintain strong market presence.

**What You Bring**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field (Advanced degree preferred)
* **10+ years** of progressive sales leadership experience for commercial contractor or a related similar service industry
* Proven success in managing multi-location/regional sales teams with measurable growth outcomes
* Experience in both individual sales performance and leading high-performing sales organizations
* Exceptional strategic thinking, with the ability to align local goals with national initiatives
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills; comfortable influencing at all organizational levels
* Analytical, data-driven mindset with ability to interpret metrics to improve results
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; CRM and sales tools knowledge required
* Experience in commercial roofing or construction industry preferred
* Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus

**Why Join Nations Roof?**

We are a growth-focused organization that values trust, collaboration, and continuous improvement. As a Regional Vice President, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping our future, with significant autonomy and leadership opportunity. You’ll be part of a company that’s large enough to compete nationally, yet nimble enough to act locally.

**Compensation and Benefits**

* Competitive Base Salary: $100K to $150K (DOE) + Incentive
* Car Allowance, Phone, and Laptop Provided
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits
* 401(K) with Employer Match
* Paid Time Off (Holidays and Vacation)
* Life, Disability, and Accident Insurance
* Career Development and Leadership Growth Opportunities

**Join Our Team**

If you're a driven, strategic sales leader with experience in commercial construction and a passion for growth, we want to hear from you! If interested Apply Now or reach out to Nations Roof Recruiter, Maribel Ortiz directly. Requisition # 2226

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Nations Roof provides equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic.

*Our company is a Drug Free Workplace*

No Recruiters.

All candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S.
